metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9897 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory corruption resulting in a potentially exploitable crash during WebGL functions using a vector constructor with a varying array within libGLES. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 50.1, Firefox ESR < 45.6, and Thunderbird < 45.6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9897` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
